results.title: Flying blind
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “B.P. Road Safety”.
The “flying blind” driver is the person who is inattentive and does not seem to be aware that three seconds of “flying blind” can cause accidents. Shows examples of inattentive driving and emphasises that fatigue can cause tragedy. Recommends that a rest stop every two hours or every 100 miles for highway driving is a safety precaution which should not be ignored.

results.title: The Artful dodger
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “B.P. Road Safety”.
There is an artful dodger in every crowd and on every road. Demonstrates the driving style of such a person - the dodging in and out of traffic at high speed which is dangerous and can cause frayed nerves and accidents. The dodger is the person who takes unnecessary risks for no apparent reason - he is not a good safe driver. No other credits available.

results.title: The Art of French cooking
results.creator_credit: Bob Bailey and R&H Media Productions
results.brief_description: A film adaptation of Fernande Garvin’s best selling cookbook. Five famous recipes, using simple ingredients are demonstrated in easy to follow detail. Emphasizes the love and care lavished on ingredients in French cuisine. French toast sandwiches, French onion soup, fish fillets in sauce, beef bourguignon, and cherries jubilee are the featured dishes.

results.title: The Andes
results.brief_description: An account of the Andes mountain range and its effect on the climate, resources and boundaries of a nation. Illustrates the hazardous crossing of the mountains by foot or horse, pointing out that this difficulty is a barrier to commerce between Chile and Argentina. No other credits available.

results.title: The Ancient world: Egypt
results.creator_credit: Ray Garner, American Research Center, Egypt and Archaelogical Institute of America
results.brief_description: The story of Egypt from the prehistoric period to the time of the Ptolemies. The beginnings of monumental art are shown at Sakkara, the funeral temple and the step pyramid. The glories of the Old Kingdom, the Pyramids, the Sphinx at Giza, and the artistry of the Middle Kingdom are illustrated in detail. Creations of the great Pharoahs are presented; the temples of Karnak and Luxor, the Colossi of Abu Simbel, and the treasures of the city of Akhenaten and the tomb of Tutankhamen. Scenes painted on temple walls showing the life of the ancient Egyptians are included.

results.title: The American road
results.brief_description: Produced to celebrate the 50th anniversary of the Ford Motor Company, this film traces the development of American highways over the last 50 years. It tells the story of man’s method of transportation and how it has influenced his life, business, health and recreation. Includes archival footage of the early days of Henry Ford’s factory, such as the creation of the first assembly line.

results.title: The Amazing newborn
results.creator_credit: Patricia E Rambasek and Maureen Hack
results.brief_description: Shows how normal infants aged 1-7 days can see and have visual preferences, turn their heads in response to spoken words, mimic and move in rhythm to parental voices. It also shows the six states of consciousness first observed by Peter Wolff.

results.title: The Airport
results.brief_description: Bridget Robertson goes to the airport to collect her sister’s body. She reflects on Tina’s life, cut short at 25 in a motor bike accident.

holdings.name: MPEG-4 Digital File; ACMI Digital Access Copy - overscan

results.title: The Afternoon house
results.brief_description: An experimental film showing the fascination of an old house and its garden for a small girl. She goes there to retrieve a lost ball, and wanders about looking at the trees and flowers first, and then going through the Georgian doorway and up the staircase exploring the rooms, looking at the pictures, trying an old fashioned cane chair and then, becoming engrossed in her surroundings, she knocks over a vase of daisies and is frightened as she sees ugly masks staring at her from the walls. She dashes downstairs and out the gate without stopping even to retrieve her ball. Photographed by Mike Browning, music by Allan Lee.

results.title: The Adventures of Floss the Fairy and Riddley Robot: the letter Z runs away
results.brief_description: Written and produced by an Early Childhood teacher in Queensland, this tape is aimed at assisting young children in developing literacy and numeracy skills. The video is interactive, allowing young children to discover and learn through literacy and numeracy experiences, and the fantasy story encompasses songs that are supported by 3D visual effects, thus creating a fun learning environment that further develops confidence and success. Areas covered include; spatial and positional word vocabulary and relationships, numbers, the alphabet, fine motor movements, self esteem, music and movement. ‘The Adventures of Floss the Fairy and Riddley Robot’ will entertain and educate children aged 7 months to 7 years.
